Message.Title: Yahoo upgraded to buy from hold: Cantor Fitzgerald, PT raised to $26
Message.Msg: Yahoo Inc. YHOO +0.88% was upgraded to buy from hold on Tuesday by analysts at Cantor Fitzgerald, who said they believe the firm has stabilized its underlying operations. Additional factors for the upgrade are the material re-valuation of Yahoo's Asian assets and the likelihood of an $1.5 billion active buyback by the firm, the analysts said. The analysts raised their target price for Yahoo to $26 from $21, after adjusting the Alibaba/Yahoo Japan valuation on new disclosures. Alibaba is Yahoo's strategic partnership in China and financial results show 74% growth in revenue and 111% growth in operating income for 2012, noted the analysts. Yahoo Japan has continued to outperform since then end of 2012 when Yahoo increased its stake, said the analysts. Management comments at recent events have indicated more buybacks are ahead. Yahoo shares rose more than 1% in pre-market trading.

Topic.Title: Alibaba and Yahoo

Message.Msg: Yahoo is not a search engine. Yahoo uses the Bing search engine owned by Microsoft. The closest definition of Yahoo is probably web portal. Alibaba Group is not a buy direct wholesale site. Alibaba Group is a holding company for various companies. The relationship between the two does very little to help income. That is why Yahoo has been selling Alibaba Group parts.

Message.Title: Google’s Arora Says He’s Open to Expanding Yahoo Ad Relationship
Message.Msg: Google Inc. (GOOG), which provides some Internet advertising services to Web-portal Yahoo! Inc., is interested in expanding the relationship, Google Senior Vice President Nikesh Arora said. The two companies signed an agreement in February for so- called contextual ads, which use content on Web pages to show related listings. The promotions are based on Google’s AdSense and AdMob services. Google, operator of the world’s most popular search engine, could also possibly work with Yahoo on search-based advertising, Arora said at a Deutsche Bank AG media and telecommunications conference in Palm Beach, Florida. An alliance between the two could affect Yahoo’s 10-year search-ad deal with Microsoft Corp. (MSFT) Google in 2008 scrapped a search partnership with Yahoo after the U.S. government threatened to challenge the agreement. Yahoo can cancel their search agreement with Microsoft on March 31, 2013.

Topic.Title: Google’s Arora Says He’s Open to Expanding Yahoo Ad Relationship

Message.Msg: Google, operator of the world’s most popular search engine, could also possibly work with Yahoo on search-based advertising, Arora said at a Deutsche Bank AG media and telecommunications conference in Palm Beach, Florida. For those not smart enough to understand what that means, Yahoo's search partnership with Bing is dead.

Topic.Title: YaHoo Message Boards will Shut down End of March!!!!!!

Message.Msg: Yahoo's Message Boards for Finance & Sports will NOT be closed down. "Effective April 1, 2013, the Yahoo Message Boards Web site will shut down. Our message boards on individual properties (like Yahoo Finance and Yahoo Fantasy Sports) will remain active."

Topic.Title: March 31 Bing Search deal will be canceled, May 10 Jack Ma steps down, Yahoo Japan to be sold

Message.Msg: Don't bet on it. Gates is very close with Ballmer and Microsoft is exactly in the position where Yahoo was last summer when I began to buy. MSFT, like Yahoo, was written off by fools who are now wishing they were at our Yahoo money party. MSFT has nothing but growth opportunities in front of it. As Apple slides and folks sour with Google (they are), MSFT steps into the tablet market with the amazing Surface Pro 128 (a full computer in tablet format) and Windows phones with Nokia (all brand new markets for MSFT), plus the new XBox is about to be released which will position MSFT to compete with Netflix head to head (another new market). And Windows 8 continues to spread its tenacles. Nevermind Azure. MSFT is today's Yahoo last year. I'm long Yahoo and I'm now long MSFT.
